Title: VP, Regulatory Affairs and Compliance
RoleDescription:
The core function of this role as the VP, Regulatory Affairs and Compliance is to provide Strategic Leadership and Advocacy for Pilot within the complex regulatory landscape of the energy, transportation, and travel center industries.1.) Strategic Leadership: Serves as a trusted advocate for Pilot and the travel center industry by developing and implementing the company's regulatory strategy in alignment with enterprise objectives and growth initiatives. 2.) Develops and implements regulatory strategies: Crafts and executes top level strategies that map the enterprise to current and future energy regulations concerning energy, midstream, transportation, infrastructure, environmental compliance, and travel center operations. 3.) Regulatory Interpretation and Guidance: Interprets complex regulatory requirements across with key stakeholders (internal partners, commercial units, external partners, industry regulatory bodies and organizations) 4.) Advocacy and Influence: Establish and maintains relationships with regulatory agencies, influencing the development of new policies and regulations that impact the energy and travel center industries. Responsible for building coalitions in support of position on key issues in coordination with regulatory agencies. 5.) Change Management: Drives change management initiatives within the organization to adapt to evolving regulatory landscapes, implementing new processes and programs to ensure compliance.6.) Serve as leader of the internal regulatory affairs team, to include but not limited to a head of regulatory affairs, an associate general counsel, and various support staff. Advanced degree or legal degree is bonus but not required.Experience in compliance 10 years along with minimum 5 years min.Team Leadership experience. Experience in engaging with regulators and regulatory bodies.Nation-wide Medical Plan/Dental/Vision

Title: Director, Legal Operations
RoleDescription:
Our Director of Legal Operations oversees litigation support, including e-discovery, and leads the development of a centralized knowledge management system to standardize legal documents and practices across the company.1) Strategic leadership: leads, develops and transforms how the legal function operates and contributes to Pilots broader business by improving operational excellence and leading legal technology and process optimization in order to shape strategy, coordinate execution, and ensure collaboration across the legal function and commercial partners.2.) Operations management: develop long term roadmap to grow legal operations and improve overall Legal team effectiveness. Promote process optimization across contract lifecycle management, litigation, IP, entity management, and knowledge management. Oversee legal project management, resource allocation, and internal team workflows to ensure priorities are implemented. Implement systems and infrastructure that allow the Legal team to support our needs at scale.3.) Financial Management and Data Analytics:  Manage Legal budget forecasting, tracking, and reporting with Finance. Build and manage a legal vendor program that ensures high-quality support at efficient costs.
Use data and analytics to evaluate team performance, vendor metrics, and operational measurements. Engage in strategic planning and goal setting.4.) Technology and Litigation Support:  Define and maintain the Legal technology roadmap, identifying automation and efficiency opportunities. Oversee litigation support operations, including e-discovery tools and workflows.5.) Knowledge and Information Management: Lead the development of a centralized knowledge management framework for contracts, policies, templates, and institutional knowledge. Promote consistency and standardization across global legal documentation and practices.5-10 years experience with tech implementation, optimization Min of 2 years working with legal departments.Experience with financial budgeting process. Title: Travel Center Assistant Manager
RoleDescription:
Pilot Flying J is seeking an experienced Retail Assistant Manager to oversee our high-volume retail facilities. You will be responsible for the generation and execution of travel center and restaurant business plans to achieve established standards, sales and profit objectives as well as customer satisfaction.

The Retail Assistant Manager will also be:Ensuring that customer expectations are metConducting meetings with subordinate employeesMaintaining effective vendor relationshipsAs a Retail Assistant Manager for Pilot Flying J, you will build, coach, manage and develop teams from a staffing, interviewing, hiring and training standpoint.Additional responsibilities for the Retail Assistant Manager include:Driving salesManaging team membersTracking inventoryProviding customer servicePerforming P&L analysisPay Rates Starting between: $41,700.00 - $60,460.00 / yearAs a Retail Assistant Manager, you must exemplify integrity and accountability at the managerial level as well as demonstrate excellent team leadership skills. Furthermore, you must be able to work a flexible schedule of nights, days, weekends and holidays. Additional requirements of the Retail Assistant Manager include:Minimum 2-3 years of management experience in the retail, restaurant, grocery or other service industry with responsibility for financial resultsPrevious management proficiency in high volume retail with P&L accountabilityAbility to create and maintain a customer focused cultureFuel DiscountNation-wide Medical Plan/Dental/Vision401(k)Flexible Spending AccountsAdoption AssistanceTuition ReimbursementFlexible ScheduleWeekly Pay

Title: Engineer II, Analytics
RoleDescription:
The purpose of this Knoxville, TN based job is to design, test, and implement new and/or improve existing features into Data & AI data products. Research, design, build, test, and track new descriptive and predictive applications for Data & AI that deliver impact to the organization.Assist in forming business strategy through exploratory data analysis and business understanding.Integrate data from disparate sources (internal and external) into data products that are consumed by business stakeholdersCreate and maintain architecture and systems documentation for analytical products developed by Data & AICreate and maintain data product source code in a source control repository (GitHub)Identify opportunities for improvement in data quality, which leads to performance and accuracy improvements in Data & AI data productsConsult on and execute opportunities for process automationImplement data structures using best practices for data modeling and visualizationIdentify opportunities for improvements to data quality to optimize data product performanceEstablish Data & AI Data best practices and build data products that provide single-source-of-truth foundational accuracyContinually improve ongoing data pipelines and simplify self-service support for busines stakeholders and Business AnalystsParticipate in Data and Analytics Governance best practices by documenting data structures, pipelines, and outputs across the entire organizationModel behaviors that support the companys common purpose; ensure guests and team members are supported at the highest levelEnsure all activities are in compliance with rules, regulations, policies, and proceduresDrive discussion with senior leaders to generate insightsComplete other duties as assignedWe are seeking applicants with a local presence in Knoxville, TN or the surrounding communities.This position does not support immigration sponsorship. To be considered you must have the legal right to work in United States without additional sponsorshipBachelor's degree in mathematics, computer science, engineering, or other quantitative discipline required, Masters degree highly preferredMinimum 3 years' experience in analytics/engineering or related industries preferredExpertise in SQLExpertise in R or PythonNation-wide Medical Plan/Dental/Vision
